thread.title: Woman accused of killing Kim Jong Nam says she got $90 for prank
thread.title_full: Woman accused of killing Kim Jong Nam says she got $90 for prank

author: CHRIS SOMMERFELDT
title: Woman accused of killing Kim Jong Nam says she got $90 for prank
text:
Woman accused of poisoning Kim Jong Nam to death claims she got $90 to carry out a prank Woman accused of killing Kim Jong Nam says she got $90 for prank Kim Jong Nam was poisoned to death on Feb. 13. (Kyodo News via AP) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Updated: Saturday, February 25, 2017, 5:18 AM 
One of the women suspected of carrying out a spy novel-like attack that killed North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un’s half-brother has revealed that she was paid $90 for what she thought was going to be a prank, an official said Saturday. 
Siti Aisyah, a 25-year-old Indonesian native, killed Kim Jong Nam at the Kuala Lumpur airport in Malaysia on Feb. 13 by spraying him in the face with the VX nerve agent — one of the most powerful poisons in the world. 
Malaysian officials have previously rejected Aisyah’s claim that she and Doan Thi Huong were duped into smearing something onto Kim’s face while he was walking through one of the airport’s terminals. The story went viral after it became apparent that Doan had worn a sweatshirt with the letters “LOL” emblazoned across the front. One of the women wore a sweatshirt with the letters “LOL” emblazoned across the front. (JEON HEON-KYUN/EPA) 
Aisyah on Saturday pleaded to authorities to believe her, according to Andriano Erwin, Indonesia’s deputy ambassador to Malaysia. She also told investigators that she did not want her parents to visit her while in custody. 
Trump, Abe discussed N. Korea missile launch at public dinner 
“She doesn’t want her family get sad to see her condition,” Erwin said after a 30-minute meeting with Aisyah. “She only delivered a message through us to her father and mother not to be worried and take care of their health.” Siti Aisyah and Doan Thi Huong are among four people arrested in Kim's death. (Royal Malaysian Police/AFP/Getty Images) 
Kim’s death made international headlines, as investigators suspect that his authoritarian half-brother might have masterminded the slaying of his sibling. Though Kim Jong Nam wasn’t a political threat — having been exiled from North Korea for taking a secret trip to Japan’s Disneyland in 2001 — Kim Jong Un might have considered him a potential rival in the secluded country’s dynastic dictatorship. 
The revelation that the VX nerve agent most likely caused Kim’s death appears to be yet another indication that North Korea could have been behind the mysterious murder. The nation never signed a treaty that banned the deadly substance and has spent decades developing a sophisticated chemical weapons program. 
With News Wire Services
